entry.title: Breaking the ALASKA contest
entry.content:
ALASKA is a Steganalysis challenge “into the wilderness of the real world”. It consists of a Steganalysis task in a highly diverse source of JPEG embedded images: diverse JPEG quality factors, sensors, development and processing history, embedding algorithms, sizes and payloads.

My research team (DDE Binghamton) and I participated in ALASKA phase 2 and ranked #1 out of all research teams involved (Cf. Leaderboard).

Stay tuned for more details about our participation in ALASKA.
entry.summary: ALASKA is a Steganalysis challenge “into the wilderness of the real world”. It consists of a Steganalysis task in a highly diverse source of JPEG embedded images: diverse JPEG quality factors, sensors, development and processing history, embedding algorithms, sizes and payloads.

entry.title: Optimistic Q-Learning article on Medium
entry.content:
Mostafa Bouziane and I have published our first Medium article. We talk about Q-Learning and explore the use of an Upper Confidence Bound exploration strategy.

This is more a popular scientific piece where no prior knowledge of Reinforcement Learning is assumed.

All the codes used for this are available in this repo.
entry.summary: Mostafa Bouziane and I have published our first Medium article. We talk about Q-Learning and explore the use of an Upper Confidence Bound exploration strategy.

entry.title: Predicting bankruptcy using 64 features
entry.content:
Mostafa Bouziane and I ranked 2nd at the annual DAD Kaggle.

The Kaggle consisted in predicting bankrupt compagnies based on 64 features from their financial reports.

This Kaggle’s challenge was dealing with unbalanced classes, with different proportions in training and testing set.

Check our slides here.
entry.summary: Mostafa Bouziane and I ranked 2nd at the annual DAD Kaggle.
